name: Rogue Wave Software
overview: Rogue Wave Software, Inc. engages in the development, sale, and support of object-oriented and infrastructure software technology. Its Rogue Wave SourcePro C++ extends the life of existing C++ applications by helping development teams deliver applications that use extensible markup language and simple object access protocol based Web services. Rogue Wave Stingray Studio offers higher-level graphical user interface components for MicrosoftÂ® WindowsÂ® platforms. Its Light Weight Enterprise Integration Framework is a product that facilitates the development of service-based architectures by creating Web services that can connect C++ applications to Java/J2EE and .NET applications. Rogue Wave Application Tuning System provides application stability by reducing heap contention and optimizing memory allocation in multithreaded applications. The company markets its products to information technology development managers, independent software vendors, value-added resellers, original equipment manufacturers, and professional programmers. The company operates through its offices in US, France, Germany, Italy, UK, and Japan. Competitors for the company include ILOG, Borland, IBM, Tibco, Webmethods, Microsoft, Oracle, Sun Microsystems, BEA, Systinet, DataDirect, and IONA. It was formerly known as Rogue Wave Acquisition Corporation and changed its name in 1996. The company was founded in 1989 and is based in Boulder, Colorado. As of December 17, 2003, Rogue Wave Software Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Healthvision Inc.

acquisitions.source_description: Rogue Wave Acquires Performance Optimization Vendor Acumem
